abstract: Former boxing champion Dewey Bozella, exonerated in 1977 murder for which he was wrongfully imprisoned, reaches tentative settlement with New York's Dutchess County; under tentative settlement, county will pay undisclosed sum but will not admit to any wrongdoing.
lead_paragraph: Dewey Bozella, imprisoned for a 1977 murder for which he was later exonerated, has reached a tentative settlement with Dutchess County, though it will not admit wrongdoing, according to lawyers familiar with the case.
snippet: Dewey Bozella, imprisoned for a 1977 murder for which he was later exonerated, has reached a tentative settlement with Dutchess County, though it will not admit wrongdoing, according to lawyers familiar with the case.

headline.main: After 26 Years in Prison, Settling a Wrongful Conviction
headline.print_headline: After Wrongfully Serving 26 Years, Man Settles Case
